ddf06ec9-984e-4f41-b737-9b6c393d40e2.description: Earners of the Southern Gas Association (SGA) Natural Gas Champion badge understand the fundamentals of the natural gas industry and have gained the tools necessary to engage in crucial conversations about the benefits natural gas provides to customers, the general public and the country. Champions can identify individual and interest group concerns and have practiced responding to those concerns.
ddf06ec9-984e-4f41-b737-9b6c393d40e2.name: SGA Natural Gas Champion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge successfully completed Southern Gas Association's Natural Gas Champions program.

68cc1f27-4080-407f-948c-5812f9cf9966.description: Level 1 Natural Gas Utility Ratemaking Professionals with this credential have a fundamental working knowledge of pipeline and local distribution company's ratemaking processes. Individuals have demonstrated the ability to identify regulatory agency jurisdiction, determine revenue requirements, cost-causation, gradualism, and political pragmatism. They understand rate and earnings implications of O&M expense versus capital investments versus depreciation, and future trends in ratemaking.
68cc1f27-4080-407f-948c-5812f9cf9966.name: Level 1 Natural Gas Utility Ratemaking Professional

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must complete Southern Gas Association's Utility Ratemaking Fundamentals or Introduction to Ratemaking course. Additionally, they must be employed and have professional, technical, or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

4dc99219-1c74-4206-b892-1b8859e12c20.description: Level 2 Natural Gas Pipeline Compliance Specialists with this credential have demonstrated a working understanding of the Department of Transportation's pipeline safety regulations. They have satisfactorily completed fifteen development hours to understand 49 CFR Part 190, 191 and 192 and how they directly impact operations, integrity management, pipeline safety auditing, construction and compliance.
4dc99219-1c74-4206-b892-1b8859e12c20.name: Level 2 Department of Transportation Natural Gas Pipeline Compliance Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must have successfully completed fifteen hours of Southern Gas Association's DOT 192 Compliance for Natural Gas Pipeline Operators Course. Additionally, they must be employed or enrolled in an educational program with professional, technical or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

f18ea8de-59a3-4453-a18d-9809f395fb8f.description: Level 1 Natural Gas Professionals with this credential have a fundamental understanding of the natural gas industry. They have a demonstrated, working knowledge of major regulatory bodies and trade associations, upstream, midstream and downstream processes, natural gas markets and generalities of the ratemaking activities, industry-specific segments, exploration and production, utilities, environmental and safety standards, and future trends in the energy industry.
f18ea8de-59a3-4453-a18d-9809f395fb8f.name: Level 1 Natural Gas Industry Professional

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must have successfully completed Southern Gas Association's Introduction to the Natural Gas Industry course. Additionally, they must be employed or be enrolled in an educational program with professional, technical, or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

fc84df2e-ed24-4887-b270-be25d9e455a7.description: Level 2 Environmental Compliance During Pipeline Construction Specialist have a demonstrated a commitment to gain a foundational understanding of local, state and federal guidelines and regulations that pertain to laying new pipeline throughout the contiguous United States and coastal regions. Further, they have communication skills necessary to act as the moderator between the company, contractor(s), and environmental inspector (s) during the entirety of a project's life cycle.
fc84df2e-ed24-4887-b270-be25d9e455a7.name: Level 2 Environmental Compliance During Pipeline Construction Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Level 2 Environmental Compliance During Pipeline Construction Specialists with this credential must have completed Southern Gas Associations' in-person two-day workshop and onsite course material, of which requires being your group's spokesperson as a subject matter expert at least once. Additionally, they must be currently employed and have professional, technical or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

4477c823-d844-43dc-9752-6952b8513537.description: Level 2 Natural Gas Industry Cathodic Protection Specialists have a fundamental working knowledge of cathodic protection and corrosion mitigation. They have demonstrated a high level understanding of corrosion sciences and industry best practices to safeguard industry assets. Earners of this badge have familiarized themselves with federal regulatory requirements for corrosion control and incorporate best practices to protect production and storage well casings.
4477c823-d844-43dc-9752-6952b8513537.name: Level 2 Natural Gas Industry Cathodic Protection Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must have successfully completed Southern Gas Association's Cathodic Protection Primer and Fundamentals instructor-led course. Additionally, participants must be employed or enrolled in an educational program with professional, technical or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry at the time of course enrollment and when their badge is issued.

7f810517-ba59-43d6-b951-28915bf71b20.description: Level 1 Natural Gas Industry Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Professionals with this credential have a fundamental understanding of the ESG framework and its relevance to organization's risk mitigation and shareholder commitment. Individuals with this credential have a demonstrated working knowledge of how ESG impacts investors and investment decisions, how stakeholders influence corporate performance, and can analyze ESG risks, opportunities and business intelligence.
7f810517-ba59-43d6-b951-28915bf71b20.name: Level 1 Natural Gas Industry ESG Professional

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must complete 2 hours of Southern Gas Association's Introduction to ESG. Additionally, they must be currently employed or be enrolled in an educational program with professional, technical, or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

c5022e8f-ea85-4c5b-b2c1-fb7167599ab9.description: Earners of the Southern Gas Association (SGA) Energy Leadership badge have completed qualifying programs supporting their professional development as an energy leader in their organization, with their teams and in their community.
c5022e8f-ea85-4c5b-b2c1-fb7167599ab9.name: SGA Energy Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge successfully completed a min. of 8 hrs. of SGA programs related to the development of identified leadership competencies in financial acumen, negotiation, marketing skills, communication, strategic planning, building a business case, innovation, presentation skills, emotional intelligence, talent management, mentorship, professional presence, personal branding, building change, change management, influencing, building collaborative relationships and diversity & inclusion.

f6d0885f-47f0-4eeb-893d-789ad61a4aaf.description: Recipients of this credential have demonstrated dedication and outstanding leadership as a 2022-2023 SGA Committee Chair. As chair, earners have devoted time toward achieving the SGA Mission and toward sustaining the natural gas industry. This badge recognized exceptional abilities in coordinating, organization, motivating, and leading professionals throughout the value chain of the industry.
f6d0885f-47f0-4eeb-893d-789ad61a4aaf.name: 2022-2023 Southern Gas Association Committee Chair

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must serve a minimum of 12 months as an SGA committee chair while setting an exemplary standard for fellow SGA members to follow.

e8c42465-e426-4a73-91cf-f003ad068339.description: Level 1 Natural Gas Professionals with this credential have a fundamental understanding of ethics and compliance central to the natural gas industry. They have a demonstrated, working knowledge of indicators that lead to unethical behaviors, unethical theories and analysis of past organizational degradations, risks associated with ethical blindness, and how to identify and intervene to reduce risk for themselves and their organization.
e8c42465-e426-4a73-91cf-f003ad068339.name: Level 1 Natural Gas Industry Ethics and Compliance Professional

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must have successfully completed Southern Gas Association's Ethical Decision-Making course. Additionally, they must be employed by or be enrolled in an educational program with professional, technical, or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

5dd15621-40d8-4799-a812-a38c50ea6164.description: Level 2 Natural Gas Industry Inline Inspection Specialists' with this badge have a working knowledge of establishing and managing an intelligent pigging program that improves pipeline integrity. They have demonstrated a foundational knowledge of inline inspection (pigging); launching, tracking and receiving; pipeline cleaning; mapping, corrosion and crack detection inline inspection tools; and can utilize viewing and verifying inline results.
5dd15621-40d8-4799-a812-a38c50ea6164.name: Level 2 Natural Gas Industry Inline Inspection Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must have successfully completed Southern Gas Association's Practical Inline Inspection course. Additionally, they must be employed or enrolled in an educational program with professional, technical or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

b96b3ca8-f791-4d0e-a7e3-265e2c5b4408.description: Level 2 Natural Gas Utility Ratemaking Specialists with this credential have a working comprehension of pipeline and local distribution company's ratemaking processes. Individuals have demonstrated the ability to identify regulatory agency jurisdiction, determine revenue requirements, cost-causation, gradualism, and political pragmatism. They understand rate and earnings implications, performance-based ratemaking and understand how a rate case is developed by participating in a mock rate case.
b96b3ca8-f791-4d0e-a7e3-265e2c5b4408.name: Level 2 Natural Gas Utility Ratemaking Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must have successfully completed Southern Gas Association's Comprehension of Utility Ratemaking and Rate Cases course and have participated in a mock rate case. Additionally, they must be employed and have professional, technical, or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

9b810b9d-1922-461a-948a-a861c1018eb4.description: Level 3 Natural Gas Industry Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Experts with this credential have an instrumental familiarization of ESG framework and its relevance to an organization's ESG roadmap, GHG footprint, journey to net zero, climate risk and reporting, and stakeholder messaging.
9b810b9d-1922-461a-948a-a861c1018eb4.name: Level 3 Natural Gas Industry ESG Expert

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, participants must complete 4 professional development hours of Southern Gas Association's Developing the ESG Expert course framework. Additionally, they must be currently employed or be enrolled in an educational program with professional, technical, or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.

e793f51a-1377-4fd7-877f-a963610023b4.description: Level 3 Natural Gas Industry Inline Inspection Experts' have a dynamic understanding of establishing and managing an inline inspection program that contributes optimum value toward improved pipeline integrity. They have a working knowledge of the following: principles of design and operation of key systems of an intelligent pig, attributes of data analysis processes, prioritizing for inspection, repair and replacement assessments, inspection efficiency and speed control of pigs.
e793f51a-1377-4fd7-877f-a963610023b4.name: Level 3 Natural Gas Industry Inline Inspection Expert

badge_template_activities.title: Level 3 Natural Gas Industry Inline Inspection Experts' with this credential must have completed the prerequisite of Southern Gas Association's Practical Inline Inspection course in addition to Advanced Inline Inspection. Additionally, they must be currently employed and have professional, technical or field exposure that is directly attributed to the natural gas industry.
